title: High-energy cLFV at $\mu$TRISTAN: HNL extensions of the Standard Model
authors: J. Kriewald, E. Pinsard, A. M. Teixeira
abstract:
Within the context of heavy neutral lepton (HNL) extensions of the Standard
Model, we compute the cross-sections for $\mu^+ e^-\to
\ell_\alpha^+\ell_\beta^-$ scattering, as well as several angular observables.
In particular, we investigate the future sensitivity of a $\mu$TRISTAN collider
in discovering such charged lepton flavour violating processes and the
potential constraining power of these searches on the parameter space of HNL
models. Our results show that while low-energy probes of $\mu-e$ flavour
violation do offer the most promising potential, the prospects for $e\tau$ and
$\mu\tau$ flavour violation searches at $\mu$TRISTAN can exceed those of
related low-energy probes (as well as flavour violating $Z$-pole processes at
FCC-ee) by several orders of magnitude.
